caseNameFull: Ann B. HOPKINS, Appellant, v. PRICE WATERHOUSE; Ann B. HOPKINS v. PRICE WATERHOUSE, Appellant
court: Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit

opinions.snippet:
WILLIAMS, Circuit Judge,
dissenting:
The majority implicitly adopts a novel theory of liability under Title VII, but neither confronts the novelty of the theory nor gives it any intelligible bounds. Further, as it must to reach the result, it bends out of recognition this court’s holding in Toney v. Block, 705 F.2d 1364 (D.C.Cir.1983). These prodigies are necessary for the outcome because the district
